summary: JSCompiler does not recursively resolve typedefs

comments.content:
I'm fairly certain that typedefs have to be in the global scope. Although I'm not sure that has been documented anywhere or is the intent.

If you remove the goog.scope wrapper, your code compiles correctly.
no, typedefs don't have to be in the global scope. goog.scope must enclose everything in the file except goog.provide/goog.require
This issue was closed by revision r2077.
